channel.title: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]

item.title: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]For the new player, I told you to use an integer of some sort (you need to save it to characters as well)

For the message to everyone, are you sure? IT should show up on everyone’s screen, as it looped through all players.[/quote]
Uhh, ok.
And yes, the message only appeared to the player logging in.

[quote=“wanttobecoders, post:8, topic:382207”]Something like

“New player: Bob as log in for his first times !”

?[/quote]
Yes, like when a new player logs in everyone online sees.
“New player I Vain I has logged in!”

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]

item.title: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I’m not going to fix your brackets.

Use an IDE.[/quote]
I made it so there are no errors. Unfortunately, all it did was send the message to the person that logged in and no one else, even IF they are not a new player.
I want it to send a message to all the people online and only if it is a new player. :’|

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]

item.title: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

This is what I did…
I found initialise method…
When I added your code, this is what it was final:

[code][code]public void initialize() {

for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
    if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
        Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
        c2.sendMessage("@blu@New player " +playerName+ " has just logged in.");

int totalz = (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]));;
for (int d = 0; d <= 10; d++) {
	if (totalz >= ranks[d]) {
		if (d == 0) {
		if (d == 0) {
			playerRank = d+1;
			ranks[d] = totalz;
			rankPpl[d] = playerName;
		}else if (d < 10){
			if (totalz < ranks[d-1]) {
				playerRank = d+1;
				ranks[d] = totalz;
				rankPpl[d] = playerName;
			}
		}else{
			if (totalz < ranks[d-1]) {
				playerRank = 0;
			}
		}
	}
}
}[/code]

[/code]

But it got 100 errors, so I am assuming there is a missing bracket.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]

item.title: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

I added it under that and it says I’m missing a bracket but I don’t know where to put it.

Here’s my initialize method without that code:

[code]public void initialize() {

int totalz = (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]));;
for (int d = 0; d <= 10; d++) {
	if (totalz >= ranks[d]) {
		if (d == 0) {
		if (d == 0) {
			playerRank = d+1;
			ranks[d] = totalz;
			rankPpl[d] = playerName;
		}else if (d < 10){
			if (totalz < ranks[d-1]) {
				playerRank = d+1;
				ranks[d] = totalz;
				rankPpl[d] = playerName;
			}
		}else{
			if (totalz < ranks[d-1]) {
				playerRank = 0;
			}
		}
	}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Message To All When New Player Joins[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

In Client.java in the login method

if (addStarter) getPA().addStarter();

I tried adding it under that
And in Playerassistant.java

public void addStarter() { c.getItems().addItem(995,1000000); c.getItems().addItem(1731, 1); c.getItems().addItem(554,200); c.getItems().addItem(555,10000); c.getItems().addItem(556,200); c.getItems().addItem(558,600); c.getItems().addItem(560,1000); c.getItems().addItem(565,1000); c.getItems().addItem(1381,1); c.getItems().addItem(1323,1); c.getItems().addItem(841,1); c.getItems().addItem(882,500); c.getItems().addItem(392,1000); c.sendMessage("@dre@Do ::train to start training!"); c.sendMessage("@blu@Do ::staff to find out the current staff."); c.sendMessage("@blu@Do ::commands to find out what commands you can do."); c.sendMessage("@blu@Do ::rules to find out what you can and can't do."); c.getPA().showInterface(3559); c.canChangeAppearance = true; }
I tried adding it there too but didn’t work
